data_footnote: The data for the last year are provisional
graph_title: Manufacturing value added as a proportion of GDP and per capita
indicator_name: Manufacturing value added as a proportion of GDP and per capita
indicador_disponible: Manufacturing value added as a proportion of GDP and per capita
objetivo_global: 9- Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
meta_global: 9.2 Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry’s share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries
definicion: Gross value added of the manufacturing sector as a proportion of real GDP and per capita
formula:
Gross value added of the manufacturing sector as a proportion of real GDP $$PPIBVAB_{manufacturing,2022}^{t} = \frac{VAB_{manufacturing,2022}^{t}}{PIB_{2022}^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $VAB_{manufacturing,2022}^{t} =$ Gross added value of the manufacturing sector in chained volume with reference to 2022 in year $t$ $PIB^{t} =$ Gross domestic product in chained volume with reference to 2022 in year $t$
Gross added value of the manufacturing sector per capita $$PPIBPC_{manufacturing,2022}^{t} = \frac{VAB_{manufacturing,2022}^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 100$$ where: $VAB_{manufacturing,2022}^{t} =$ Gross added value of the manufacturing sector in chained volume with reference to 2022 in year $t$ $P^{t} =$ population as of 1 July of year $t$
texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
justificacion_global:
Manufacturing value added (MVA) is a well-recognized and widely used indicator by researchers 
and policy makers to assess the level of industrialization of a country. The share of MVA in GDP 
reflects the role of manufacturing in the economy and a country’s national development in general. 

MVA per capita is the basic indicator of a country’s level of industrialization adjusted for the 
size of the economy. One of the statistical uses of MVA per capita is classifying country groups 
according to the stage of industrial development. 

Source: United Nations Statistics Division
dato_global: Manufacturing value added (constant 2015 United States dollars) as a proportion of GDP (%) NV_IND_MANF UNSTATS Manufacturing value added per capita (constant 2015 United States dollars) NV_IND_MANFPC UNSTATS
comparabilidad: The available indicator does not comply with United Nations metadata but provides similar information. Data are presented in euros, not US dollars.

es.indicador_disponible: Manufacturing value added as a proportion of GDP and per capita
es.objetivo_global: 9- Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation
es.meta_global: 9.2 Promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and, by 2030, significantly raise industry’s share of employment and gross domestic product, in line with national circumstances, and double its share in least developed countries
es.definicion: Valor añadido bruto del sector manufacturero en proporción al PIB real y per cápita
es.formula:
Valor añadido bruto del sector manufacturero en proporción al PIB real $$PPIBVAB_{manufacturero,2022}^{t} = \frac{VAB_{manufacturero,2022}^{t}}{PIB_{2022}^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $VAB_{manufacturero,2022}^{t} =$ valor añadido bruto del sector manufacturero en volumen encadenado con referencia 2022 en el año $t$ $PIB^{t} =$ producto interior bruto en volumen encadenado con referencia 2022 en el año $t$
Valor añadido bruto del sector manufacturero per cápita $$PPIBPC_{manufacturero,2022}^{t} = \frac{VAB_{manufacturero,2022}^{t}}{P^{t}} \cdot 100$$ donde: $VAB_{manufacturero,2022}^{t} =$ valor añadido bruto del sector manufacturero en volumen encadenado con referencia 2022 en el año $t$ $P^{t} =$ población a 1 de julio en el año $t$
es.texto_oceca: Indicator calculated using a methodology harmonised across the central statistical bodies of the autonomous communities
es.justificacion_global:
El Valor añadido del sector manufacturero (VAM) es un indicador ampliamente reconocido y 
utilizado por investigadores y responsables de políticas para evaluar el nivel 
de industrialización de un país. La proporción del VAM en el PIB refleja el 
papel de la industria manufacturera en la economía y el desarrollo nacional de un 
país en general. 

El VAM per cápita es el indicador básico del nivel de industrialización de un país 
ajustado al tamaño de la economía. Uno de los usos estadísticos del VAM per cápita 
es la clasificación de grupos de países según la etapa de desarrollo industrial.

Fuente: División de Estadísticas de las Naciones Unidas
es.dato_global: Valor añadido manufacturero (dólares estadounidenses constantes de 2015) como proporción del PIB (%) NV_IND_MANF UNSTATS Valor añadido manufacturero per cápita (dólares estadounidenses constantes de 2015) NV_IND_MANFPC UNSTATS
es.comparabilidad: El indicador disponible no cumple con los metadatos del indicador de Naciones Unidas, pero  aporta información similar. Los datos se presentan en euros, no en dólares estadounidenses
